title: Why would this game be a B+?
body:
For comparison, I played 2 shen support games back to back.. one was an S+ and one was a B+... both games, realistically, should have been near the same. 

Game one was S+
6/0/17, 22 min game, 64% kill participation, 2 control wards, 59 CS, likely similar vision score to the second or worse
Game two was a B+
2/2/27, 27min game, 69% kill participation, 3 control wards, 80 cs, see above


How is there that kind of discrepancy? I am already Shen level 7 so I didn't need the S or anything... but this seems like a bug. I know riot doesn't release how they grade games, but I've played like 170 games as Shen support and have never had a game where I was that involved and gotten a grade that low... What am I missing?

Sorry if it's the wrong board

replies.body:
Based on KDA alone you're like what 23 kda in the first game
and 14 kda in the second one, but then you have to check your damage , I usually think of rank more as dmg per death more than total KDA tbh dying ruins your rank

aha! I just played a third game that was nearly identical to the B+ game except I didn't die (28 mins, 2/0/22, 3 control wards, slightly less CS, same gold, 63% kill part, exact same vision score etc) and got an S+... so this makes perfect sense (I mean, if using riot logic). It's really strange that 2 deaths can drop you two full ranks for basically identical games on a support especially when sometimes you have to sacrifice yourself for the adc. Definitely an enlightening post though, never thought of it as damage per death. Thanks!
Damage output, objective participation, CC score, actual effectiveness of wards, ect all matter.
